subject: Entrepreneurship
title: Sustaining vs. Disruptive: The Innovation Fork
description: A quick win: understand Sustaining vs. Disruptive: The Innovation Fork.

hook.text: Not all innovation threatens incumbents. Some makes them stronger. Christensen split innovation into two types.

buildup.text: Sustaining innovation improves existing products for existing customers‚Äîfaster chips, better cameras, bigger screens.

discovery.text: Disruptive innovation targets overlooked customers with simpler, cheaper products that 'good enough' does the job.

twist.text: Incumbents almost always win the sustaining game. But they almost always lose the disruptive one.

climax.text: Southwest Airlines disrupted full-service carriers not by being better, but by being cheap enough for new flyers.

punchline.text: 'Good enough' is the most dangerous phrase in business.

quiz.question: How does disruptive innovation differ from sustaining innovation?
options: Disruptive innovation is always more technologically advanced
Disruptive innovation targets overlooked customers with simpler, cheaper products
Disruptive innovation requires more funding than sustaining innovation
